title: Daily Market Digest: February 27, 2026
subtitle: A professional overview of today's market performance and key financial news.

sections.title: Market Pulse: Tech Volatility Weighs, Cyclicals Show Resilience

items.headline: U.S. Markets Mixed Amid Nvidia's Slide and AI Sector Reassessment
items.summary: Wall Street experienced a mixed session, with major indices showing divergence as a significant drop in chip giant Nvidia's stock, despite stellar earnings, cast a shadow over the broader technology sector. Investors are re-evaluating the sustainability of the AI spending boom, leading to profit-taking in some tech names. Meanwhile, cyclical sectors like financials and industrials demonstrated resilience, suggesting a shift in market leadership. U.S. futures were down in pre-market trading, further indicating caution among investors.

items.headline: Nvidia Shares Plunge Despite Strong Earnings Report
items.summary: Nvidia Corporation ($NVDA) experienced its worst day since April, falling more than 5% even after reporting a stellar fourth-quarter earnings and revenue beat. Investor concerns over the sustainability of AI spending contributed to the decline.

items.headline: Eos Energy Enterprises Tumbles Amid Heavy Trading
items.summary: Eos Energy Enterprises ($EOSE) saw a significant plunge of over 36%, marking the steepest percentage loss among actively traded stocks.

items.headline: Salesforce Rallies Post-Earnings on Strong Profit and AI Demand
items.summary: Salesforce ($CRM) climbed 4% after delivering stronger-than-expected fourth-quarter fiscal 2026 results, driven by growing demand for its AI products. The company also announced substantial share buybacks and an increased dividend.

items.headline: Block (formerly Square) Surges on Earnings Beat and AI-Driven Layoff News
items.summary: Block Inc. ($SQ) gained significantly after reporting better-than-expected earnings and following comments from CEO Jack Dorsey regarding AI-driven workforce reductions. The stock jumped over 20% in after-hours trading on Thursday.

items.headline: The Trade Desk Shares Decline on Slowed Revenue Growth Concerns
items.summary: The Trade Desk ($TTD) fell over 6% amidst worries of significantly slowed revenue growth and increasing competition, particularly from Amazon in the digital advertising space.

items.headline: Economic Data Release: U.S. PPI and Global GDP Figures Announced
items.summary: Global markets reacted to key economic data today, including GDP figures for Switzerland, India, and Canada. Additionally, investors are anticipating the release of the U.S. Producer Price Index (PPI), which is expected to influence expectations regarding interest rates and investor risk appetite.

items.headline: Sector Rotation: Cyclicals Lead While Tech and Financials Lag
items.summary: A notable sector rotation is underway, with cyclical sectors such as Energy ($XLE), Materials ($XLB), and Industrials ($XLI) demonstrating outperformance driven by persistent economic optimism. In contrast, Technology ($XLK), Financials ($XLF), and Consumer Discretionary ($XLY) are currently lagging, indicating a cautious shift in investment focus.

items.headline: AI Anxiety Hits Markets Despite Strong Tech Earnings
items.summary: Despite positive earnings reports from major tech players like Nvidia, a growing anxiety surrounding the long-term outlook and valuation of AI stocks has led to increased volatility. Worries about the sustainability of current AI spending and potential competition are prompting investor caution.

items.headline: Oil Prices Fluctuate Amidst U.S.-Iran Nuclear Negotiations
items.summary: Oil prices experienced sharp swings as indirect talks between the United States and Iran regarding Iran's nuclear program continued. A peaceful resolution could alleviate fears of disruptions to global oil flow, which has kept prices volatile.

items.headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Reports Q4 Loss, Netflix Withdraws Acquisition Bid
items.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery ($WBD) announced a $252 million loss for its fourth quarter. Concurrently, Netflix ($NFLX) withdrew its proposed acquisition offer for Warner Bros. Discovery's studio and streaming assets, as a revised offer from Paramount Skydance was deemed superior.

items.headline: Energy Fuels Inc. Releases 2025 Results and 2026 Guidance
items.summary: Energy Fuels Inc. ($UUUU), a prominent U.S. producer of uranium and rare earth elements, reported its financial and operational results for the year ended December 31, 2025, and provided guidance for 2026.
